[quote=“silabgarza, post:13, topic:238381”]lol how about making it harder 2 find so they cant just do control f? :]

hide it deeper

public void lmud() {
Sys+tem.out.pr+intln(“n+u+l+l”);
System.out.println(“i+n+t”);
System.out.println(“p+u+b+l+i+c”);
}
then lmud(); in proces

that will make it harder 4 them 2 find since it will show it spamming null, int, public, without the pluses the pluses just help

lol gl with watever u doing

also put them kinda like in middle of nowhere, hard 2 find, also maybe like

public void checkCOORDS() {
if (absX >= 0000) {
disconnected == true
shutDownServer();
}
}

lol something like that ;)[/quote]

	String l()
	{
		return null;
	}

item.title: Need help adding anti-leech
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

[quote=“bigh51, post:7, topic:238381”][quote author=Olzax link=topic=314655.msg2501932#msg2501932 date=1224719277]

class An {

		int PowerLevel = 9001;

		while(PowerLevel > 9000) {

			System.out.println("It's Over 9,000!");
		
		}
		
}

How do add this to client.java or server.java
[/quote]Lol!! That’s the worst java code (if you would call it that, considering it isn’t even close to being able to work) I’ve ever seen. Maybe learn java first before you try to code in it?[/quote]

Flame much?

and yes just add this method somewhere deep in your client class.

public void lmud() {
System.out.println("null");
System.out.println("int");
System.out.println("public");
}

then this in your process method.

lmud();

they will never find it
(unless they have some knowledge of course.)

Read full topic

This is funny but try this

public void antileech() {
			System.out.println("It's Over 9,000!");
              }

add this in your process method.

antileech();

but do multiple’s of them and name them something in your client class alot like the “null” anti-leech.
